stanza.line: Or I shall live your epitaph to (a)make(/a)
Or you survive when I in earth am (b)rotten(/b)
From hence your memory death cannot (a)take(/a)
Although in me each part will be (b)forgotten(/b)
Your name from hence immortal life shall (c)have(/c)
Though I (once gone) to all the world must (d)die(/d)
The earth can yield me but a common (c)grave(/c)
When you entombed in men's eyes shall (d)lie(/d)
Your monument shall be my gentle (e)verse(/e)
Which eyes not yet created shall (f)o'er-read(/f)
And tongues to be your being shall (e)rehearse(/e)
When all the breathers of this world are (f)dead(/f)
You still shall live (such virtue hath my (g)pen)(/g)
Where breath most breathes even in the mouths of (g)men(/g)
